educations.schoolName: The University of Texas at Austin

positions.description:
Represented trade associations and manufacturers of food and food contact substances in litigation matters and advised clients on regulatory compliance under municipal and state regulations.  Highlights include: 
Advising clients on civil litigation matters primarily related to discovery
Researching legislative history and regulatory rulemakings and creating and analyzing surveys of municipal regulations impacting client supply chains to advise clients on product compliance
Drafting research memoranda on legal problems and regulatory compliance issues
Writing objections, litigation holds, FOIA requests, motions, and preparing for document productions and depositions
Drafting articles on food-related litigation, class actions, and regulatory developments
Representing client in dispute resolution working group
Assisting with motions for summary judgment, motions to dismiss, motions for sanctions and fees
positions.title: Associate

positions.companyName: Cottrell Fletcher Schinstock Bartol & Cottrell PC
positions.description: Drafted divorce and separation filings, researched equitable distribution issues, and prepared clients for Ore Tenus hearings.
positions.title: Family Law Intern

positions.description:

Researched international chemical control laws 
Wrote website articles summarizing notable legal news
Drafted meeting summary memoranda for submission to the client
positions.title: Summer Associate

positions.description:
Drafted field officer guidance memoranda and researched constitutional issues regarding immigration enforcement methods.   Highlights include:
Researching 4th Amendment case law, legislative history, and regulatory rulemakings
Preparing administrative records for litigation and enforcement filings
positions.title: Intern, Office of the Principal Legal Advisor, Detention and Removal Law Section

positions.description:

Wrote articles discussing food contact regulatory legislations worldwide

positions.title: Summer Intern, Food & Drug Regulatory Practice

positions.description:
Support USPS Chief Financial Officer and Deputy Postmaster General in attaining Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) compliance via the implementation of a structured Program Management Processes. Highlights include:
Managing client relationship
Creating and presenting targeted data reports to leadership weekly
Developing automated scorecard used to track field compliance
Validating systems requirements modifications
Performing ad-hoc data analysis on data irregularities
Detecting and mitigating data reporting gaps through analysis of field data and business processes
Reviewing system modifications to identify potential areas conflicts
Designing and deploying SharePoint system to collect and report field status
positions.title: Reporting Analyst, US Postal Service, Financial Management Team/Sarbanes Oxley Compliance

positions.description:
Developed test plans, conditions, scripts, and input data across all testing phases for a large scale custom development effort to modernize postage statement billing system.  Highlights include:
Developing testing standards, procedures, requirements traceability matrix, and design requirements for system validations
Collaborating with application development team to identify and resolve system issues
positions.title: Testing Analyst, US Postal Service, Testing Team

positions.description:
Supported deployment of the most advanced financial management system in Army history.  Highlights include:
Developing presentations, interactive scripts, and job aids for system testing and field training
Reporting interface readiness to deployment leadership weekly
Communicating functional and build interface issues to deployment team
Coordinating technical questions and concerns from field installations
Creating deployment task criteria and preparation reporting system processes
Creating demonstration scripts for live environment testing
Researching technical issues and business requirements
positions.title: Application Deployment Liaison, US Army, Deployment Team

positions.description:
Reviewed deliverables before client submission and managed deliverable repositories
Conducted audits of baseline repositories
Baselined deliverables as needed by configuration management process
Developed program and office procedure documents for configuration management processes
Coordinated high-profile milestone meetings and information sessions
positions.title: Configuration Management Analyst, US Army, Project Management Office

Fabricated a custom catheter tip
Determined optimal catheter entry pathway
positions.title: Researcher, Arterial Catheter Senior Design Project

positions.description: Researched infant geometry models, developed leakage prevention prototypes, conducted lab testing and clinical trials on prototypes, and published technical letter.
